document.masterDocTitle: Terebellidae (Polychaeta: Terebellida) from the Grand Caribbean region 2320

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Terebellidae (Polychaeta: Terebellida) from the Grand Caribbean region 2320

heading.emphasis: Key to subfamilies, genera and species of Terebellidae from the Grand Caribbean

paragraph.keyLead:
5. Thoracic uncini in single row from chaetiger 2–6 ........................................................
Neoamphitrite sp. A
Kritzler, 1984

7. With eyespots, 19 segments with notochaetae ..............................................................
Neoleprea sp. A
Kritzler, 1984

10. Eyespots present; about 80 segments with notochaetae ............................................................
T. verrilli Holthe, 1986

- Eyespots absent; about 26 segments with notochaetae ..........................................................
T. turgidula Ehlers, 1887

keyLead.keyStep:
11. Notopodia from segment 2, neuropodia from segment 3 ....................................
Polymniella aurantiaca ( Verrill, 1900 )

12. Branchiae on segments 3, 4 and 7; uncini MF:1:4:4 ......................
T. mchughae Londoño-Mesa & Carrera-Parra, 2005

paragraph.keyLead:
- Branchiae on segments 2, 5 and 8; uncini MF:3:3–4 .............................................
T. hiata ( Treadwell, 1931 )
comb. nov.

14. Uncini of neuropodia one, at least, with long posterior process ............................(
Pista Malmgren, 1866
, partim ) 15
- Uncini of all neuropodia with short or without posterior process .............................................................................. 19

16. All thoracic uncini with long posterior process ................................................................
P. cf. fasciata (Grube, 1870)

- Dorsal lobes short, separated by a thick mid-dorsal tissue .................................
P. cetrata ( Ehlers, 1887 )
comb. nov.

20. Lateral lappets on segments 1, 2 and 3 ...........................
Pistella papillosa ( Tourtellotte & Kritzler, 1988 )
comb. nov.

- Anteior thoracic dorsum with many tubercles ...............................................
L. garciagomezi ( Londoño-Mesa, 2006 )

24. First five thoracic neuropodia with uncini in single rows .................................................................
E. rullieri
sp. nov.

- Lateral lappets from segment 3 considerably longer .................................................
Eupolymnia sp. A
Kritzler, 1984

27. Uncini on neuropodia 1–3 with long posterior process ........................
L. salazari Londoño-Mesa & Carrera-Parra, 2005

28. Uncini with teeth gradually decreasing in size; thoracic uncini with 5 teeth in single vertical series; abdominal uncini with 6 teeth ...........................................................................................................................
L. minuta Treadwell, 1929

29. Thoracic and abdominal uncini with 5 teeth in single vertical series ..............................
L. bermudensis Verrill, 1900

- Thoracic and abdominal uncini with 7 teeth in single vertical series .........................................
L. viridis Moore, 1903

- Notochaetae subdistally smooth with serrated tip ............................................................
Lanassa sp. A
Kritzler, 1984

- With 15 notopodia; first six notopodia with bilimbate chaetae of two lengths; thoracic and abdominal uncini with dental formula MF:3:3–4:6–7 ................................................................................................
S. carrerai Londoño-Mesa, 2003

- First pair of branchiae arsises dorsally to notopodia; eyespots in two lateral distinct groups on tentacular membrane .........................................................................................................................................................
S. tenhovei
sp. nov.

41. Thoracic uncini absent ...........................................................
Telothelepus cf. capensis Day, 1955
fide Kritzler, 1984

45. Notochaetae lanceolate, distally bilimbate .............................................................
T. tenuis ( Verrill, 1900 )
comb. nov.

50. Thoracic notopodia furcate or branched ...................................................
Enoplobranchus sanguineus ( Verrill, 1873 )
52. Lobules of tentacular membrane divided into 3 digitate projections ......................................................................... 53

- Lobules of the tentacular membrane folded and free, but not divided ...............................
Lysilla sp. B
Kritzler, 1984

53. With 10 pairs of notopodia; capillary chaetae smooth..................................................................
Lysilla caribe
sp. nov.

- With 13 pairs of notopodia; capillary chaetae hispid ..........................................................
Lysilla sp. A
Kritzler, 1984

58. Twenty-three pairs of notopodia; uncini from segment 16 …
P. cf. haematodes (Claparède, 1864)
fide Kritzler, 1984

- Nineteen pairs of notopodia; uncini from segment 13 …
P. cf. denticulatus de Saint-Joseph, 1894
fide Kritzler, 1984

59. Ten pairs of notopodia; uncini from segment 10 .............................................................
P. purpureus Schmarda, 1861

61. Twenty pairs of notopodia; uncini from segment 21 .........................................................
P. pennulifera Verrill, 1900

- Twelve pairs of notopodia; uncini from segment 5 ...........................
P. holthei Londoño-Mesa & Carrera-Parra, 2005

62. Thirty-one pairs of notopodia; uncini from segment 7
....................................................................... P. angeli
sp. nov.
